params._reason: Hint for case reviewers as to why the scheduled container is illegal

params._config: A ERC3000Data.Config struct holding all the new params that will control the queue

params._aclRoot: account that will be given root permissions on ACL (commonly given to factory)

params._disputeId: disputeId in the arbitrator in which the dispute over the container was created

params._container: A ERC3000Data.Container struct holding both the payload being scheduled for execution and the current configuration of the system

challenge(((uint256,uint256,address,addr.notice: Challenge a container in case its scheduling is illegal as per Config.rules. Pulls collateral and dispute fees from sender into contract

configure((uint256,(address,uint256),(ad.notice: Apply a new configuration for all *new* containers to be scheduled

execute(((uint256,uint256,address,addres.notice: Executes an action after its execution delay has passed and its state hasn't been altered by a challenge or veto

resolve(((uint256,uint256,address,addres.notice: Apply arbitrator's ruling over a challenge once it has come to a final ruling

schedule(((uint256,uint256,address,addre.notice: Schedules an action for execution, allowing for challenges and vetos on a defined time window. Pulls collateral from submitter into contract.
